content.description: Start up the thin crack using face holds and the crack for pro.  A key small nut will keep you from decking before the pin.  Encounter the crux near the pin in the middle of the face.  Reach a no hands rest and fire up the arete with great climbing and bolts for pro.  Keep going until intersecting the top of Blueberry Crack.
content.protection: Small nut, orange, black, and red metolious.  QD's.
content.location: Down and right of Blueberry Crack.  Once you are engulfed in stinging nettles start climbing leaving your belayer in pain.  Better yet, bring a machete.

content.description: Start on the ramp up to the first bolt.  Pull onto the face using the arete and good pockets.  Ballance your way up to the short, but awesome finger crack to the anchors.
content.location: The route farthest left on the Blueberry Crack wall.

content.description: You may want to stick clip the first bolt to avoid a tumble.  Crimpy, hard to read face climbing is the game.  Well spaced bolts make it exciting, but nothing too crazy.  A high quality route.
content.location: To the left of Blueberry Crack

content.description: Start up an acute corner with a thin crack in the back.  Stem your way up placing small wires and tcu's till you encouter the crux at the top of the dihedral.  Finish up on the blocky face with some very loose rock but some options for pro.
content.protection: Small to med gears.  No anchors, I just sat behind a grassy knoll and held on with my feet propped against some rocks.  I held a fall from my brother, and it felt pretty stable.
content.location: On the central part of the block overlooking the lake.  The start is on a small ledge.

content.description:
Bluebies:   What Mystique of X-Men fame has between her blue neck and her blue abdomen.   -Urban Dictionary 

  Face moves past two bolts leads to a short splitter hand crack.  Jam past the small bulge and climb back onto the face to the anchors.
content.protection: Three bolts and a #2 and #3 BD cam.  Runners useful for the first and third bolt.
content.location: Bluebies is on the eastern side of the cliff.  Look for gray hangers over the lip.

content.description: The BEST climb in the Valdez area.  Well, pretty much the only crack climb at least.  Climb the angling hand crack with good jams.  Use face holds out left to squeeze into the chimney.  From the ledge traverse out left on face holds for a good pumpy finish.
content.location: The obvious splitter on the left.

content.description: Climb up the steep golden corner with good incut holds. The crux is at the second bolt pulling over the corner onto the slab. Continue up the slab to the anchor. Good climb for a warm up or a beginner lead climb.
content.location: Just down the trail to the climbers left of Bluebies. Look for the steep corner with bolts.

content.description: Blueberry is one of the finer crags in the area.  It has a good concentration of challenging routes with fairly solid rock.  Climbing has been going on here for sometime, but I don't know any detailed information.
